page.title: 13LIFE STYLES IN FORDYCE
page.content: Life in Fordyce has changed a little since a licensed Restaurant opened in 1984,for this has brought more visitors in from surrounding towns and countryside to a village well hidden and off the beaten track.People who do not own a private car,must travel mainly by taxi-cab based in Portsoy, for there is only one regular weekly bus which runs each Thursday,leaving Fordyce at 9.4o a.m. for Banff and returning at l2.30 p.m. Passengers may use the school bus which leaves for Banff each weekday at 8 a.m. and comes back at 4.30p.m. The Post Office van visits each day except Sunday,there being one delivery and one collection daily. Visits are made by Bakers, Butchers,Fishmongers,Dairy and Drapery vans and a mobile library calls each fortnight. Policemen,based in Portsoy, only occasionally visit the village.
